definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Cup your hands under the neck and lift the head, allowing the neck to stretch.
sentences.chinese: 手掌放在頸部並托起腦袋，讓頸子得到伸展。

sentences.english: Eponine burst out laughing, and threw herself on his neck.
sentences.chinese: 愛潘妮笑了出來，跳上去抱住他的頸子。

sentences.english: And she caught her father round the neck again.
sentences.chinese: 她又抱緊她父親的頸子。

sentences.english: The necklace was no longer round her neck!
sentences.chinese: 原來頸子上的項鍊不見了。

sentences.english: His heart was filled with sadness, and he put his arms around the cow's neck.
sentences.chinese: 他心中悲傷逾恆，用雙臂緊抱着她的頸子。

sentences.english: Shasta strolled over to it and patted its neck.
sentences.chinese: 沙斯塔踅過去，拍拍馬兒的頸子。

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
variant of 腳趾|脚趾[jiao3 zhi3]
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
